traditionally the rice noodle is made by
soaking the rice in water overnight then
the rice is crowd in this kind of Grider
into a white batter at a slope like this

even sheet of rice noodles only do
maximum two layers at a time steamed for

on a bamboo mat to air dry the righteous
are ready to be stacked on one another
and the process goes on in Vietnam we
never buy dry noodles sold in a package
because fresh noodles are sold as
every local market it always fascinates
me how the auntie can use that knife to

kid I could spend all days watching her
nowadays technology developed and there
could be a lot of machines involved in
the noodle production is so much faster
and more accurate to slide the noodle
with the machines like this for example
but I still really adore the traditional
handmade method because I think it's
just so cool ok so this is how you can
make add the rice noodles at home in a
large mixing bowl combine 1 cup of rice
flour and 1 cup of tapioca starch with 2
cups of water basically the water volume
is the same as a total flour and starch
volume the tapioca starch helps to make
the noodles more flexible and chewy
if you want the noodles to be softer
just reduce the tab you can amount and
the water amounts accordingly to prepare
the beef slightingly against the grain
so it would be more tender after storing
season the beef with a teaspoon of
chicken stock which is optional you can
also use sugar instead a tablespoon of
minced garlic a teaspoon of minced
ginger and a tablespoon of fish sauce
also add some pepper and mix well
another trick to have to be more tender
and juicy after the frying is to add
some vegetable oil so one more
tablespoon of vegetable oil into the
marinade mix well and set aside for
about 15 minutes now heat some oil in a
wok add some minced garlic and fry until
fragrant then toss in the beef and
stir-fry until it is no longer pink this
step should be done quickly on happy
you can have onion slices if you like
then turn off the heat and let it cool a
little after resting the batter for one
or two hours add some salt and 2
teaspoons of vegetable oil this will
prevent the rashes from sticking always
stir up the batter before steaming this
is a very easy way to set up the steamer
this steaming rack can be bought at
Asian store for just one or two dollars
only brush some vegetable oil on the
plate and steam the plate first for one
to two minutes when the place is nice
and hot later the batter over just
enough to cover the base of the plate
you can test the first sheet to see how
much butter is needed to get your
desired thickness then just use the same
amount for the following sheets cover
and steam for about 45 minutes until it
turns quite translucent
ladies run the spatula around the edges
and you should be able to easily peel
off the right sheets from the plate
because of the oil added in the batter
it should be able to stack on each other
without sticking
return the plate to the steamer and
continue the steaming process if you

just make sure you use medium low to
